publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-462 Lewis Macdonald: Peacock Visual Arts—That the Parliament congratulates Peacock Visual Arts on the proposal for a new centre for contemporary arts in Union Terrace Gardens, Aberdeen; believes that the proposed new centre will have a positive impact on Aberdeen’s cultural life, bringing significant cultural and economic benefits to Aberdeen and the north east as well as breathing new life into Union Terrace Gardens; recognises that the imaginative design by architects Brisac Gonzalez is of world-class standard and will strengthen Aberdeen’s standing on the international cultural map, and looks forward to the early completion of the project and opening of Aberdeen Contemporary Arts Centre. Supported by: Richard Baker*, Jamie Stone*, Marlyn Glen*, Patricia Ferguson*, Nanette Milne*, Kenneth Gibson*, David Stewart*, Karen Gillon*, Des McNulty*, Alison McInnes*, Trish Godman*, Karen Whitefield*, Jackie Baillie*
S3M-462 Peacock Visual Arts (lodged on 12 September 2007) Mary Mulligan*

S3M-462 Lewis Macdonald: Peacock Visual Arts—That the Parliament congratulates Peacock Visual Arts on the proposal for a new centre for contemporary arts in Union Terrace Gardens, Aberdeen; believes that the proposed new centre will have a positive impact on Aberdeen’s cultural life, bringing significant cultural and economic benefits to Aberdeen and the north east as well as breathing new life into Union Terrace Gardens; recognises that the imaginative design by architects Brisac Gonzalez is of world-class standard and will strengthen Aberdeen’s standing on the international cultural map, and looks forward to the early completion of the project and opening of Aberdeen Contemporary Arts Centre. Supported by: Richard Baker, Jamie Stone, Marlyn Glen, Patricia Ferguson, Nanette Milne, Kenneth Gibson, David Stewart, Karen Gillon, Des McNulty, Alison McInnes, Trish Godman, Karen Whitefield, Jackie Baillie, Mary Mulligan
S3M-462 Peacock Visual Arts (lodged on 12 September 2007) Peter Peacock*
